newsitem.title: FRANCE: CDC says did not sell Valeo shares.
newsitem.headline: CDC says did not sell Valeo shares.

text.p: French state-owned bank Caisse des Depots et Consignation (CDC) said on Wednesday it was not behind the sale of 2.5 million shares of auto parts maker Valeo carried out after market hours.
"It is not us," a company official said in response to a query.
Earlier, market sources said a sale of 2.5 million shares in Valeo, representing about 3.5 percent of the company's capital was carried out at a price of 368 francs per share.
Several sources said shares were being placed by CDC Bourse and JP Morgan.
The sources said the seller was probably either CDC or JP Morgan, with most saying JP Morgan the most likely.

Cerus, a French investment firm controlled by Italian businessman Carlo de Benedetti, said last November 5 that it sold its 28 percent share of Valeo. At the time CDC increased its share in Valeo to about 5.4 percent from 1.9 percent.
French industrial holding CGIP bought 20 percent Cerus's holding with the rest being purchased by CDC and investment fund JP Morgan GT Corp.
